result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett R Rasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid in 30 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett R Rasch

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;  signed on 09-30-2022 and filed by Brett R. Rasch
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:56 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.
Defendant Brett R Rasch in court. 

Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to an attorney.
Defendant waives his right to an attorney.
Court will accept the defendant's waiver of right to an attorney.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.


Court orders the following:	
3 Days Jail.
3 Days Credit.
TIME SERVED.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid in full within 30 days.
Alternate:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to have no contact with individuals/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

01:29 PM Defendant Brett R Rasch in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern, as a friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brett R Rasch
Current: 522 N. Barstow Street, Waukesha, WI 53186   (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 1703 Elder St,#106, Waukesha, WI 53188
